question_text:
Let $A,$ $B,$ $C$ be the angles of a non-right triangle.  Compute
\[\begin{vmatrix} \tan A & 1  & 1 \\ 1 & \tan B & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & \tan C \end{vmatrix}.\]
response:
We have that

\begin{align*}
&\begin{vmatrix} \tan A & 1  & 1 \\ 1 & \tan B & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & \tan C \end{vmatrix}\\
=&\begin{vmatrix} \tan A & 1  & 0 \\ 1 & \tan B & 0 \\ 1 & 1 & \tan C - 1 \end{vmatrix}-\begin{vmatrix} \tan A & 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & \tan C-1 \end{vmatrix}\\
=&(\tan A)(\tan B(\tan C-1)-1)-0+\begin{vmatrix} \tan A & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \\ 1 & -1 & \tan C-1 \end{vmatrix}
&\\
=&\tan A (\tan B\tan C-\tan B-\tan C +1)-(\tan B-\tan A)(1+\tan C-1)\\
=&\tan A (\tan B\tan C-\tan B-\tan C+1)-(0)
&\\
=& \tan A(\tan B \tan C - \tan B - \tan C + 1)\\
=& \tan A \big((\tan B+\tan C)\tan C-(\tan B+\tan C)+1\big)\\
=& \tan A (\tan B+\tan C)(\tan C-1)+(\tan B-\tan C)\\
=&(\tan A + \tan B - 1)(0)-\tan (A+C)
&\\
=& \boxed{0}
\end{align*}

where we used the fact that $A+B+C = 180^{\circ}$ for a non-right triangle and $\tan(A+C) = \frac{\tan A + \tan B}{1-\tan A\tan B}.$

The final answer is 0.
